Issues.Title: "is-block" modifier class for buttons does not with <button> elements
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.1
My **browser** is: Google Chrome 88.0.4324.190 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Description

When using a button element with the `button` class, the `is-block` modifier class doesn't change it.

### Steps to Reproduce

```
<button type="submit" class="button is-success is-block">Create</button>
```

### Expected behavior

The button should be the full width of the page.

### Actual behavior

The button's size does not change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""is-block" modifier class for buttons does not with <button> elements" (#3282)

Issues.Title: Custom background color value for var $white-ter is not overwritten
Issues.Body:
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [9.1.0]
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

When adding a custom value for `$white-ter` and adding it to the `$colors` map for some reason my div with the class `has-background-white-ter` gets the "default" `$white-ter` value "whitesmoke" and not my custom value.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add a custom value vor $white-ter, for example: `$white-ter: hsl(220, 55%, 96%);`
2. Add the custom value to the `$colors` map:

```
$addColors: (
    "white-ter":($white-ter, $white),
);
$colors: map-merge($colors, $addColors);

```
3. Add a div with the class `has-background-white-ter` to your html

### Expected behavior

The div should have the custom value for `$white-ter` set as the background color.

### Actual behavior

The "default" value `whitesmoke` is used as the background color.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4902585/109402004-9c361000-7952-11eb-9175-fe58a07bbfdf.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom background color value for var $white-ter is not overwritten" (#3281)

Issues.Title: How to change font families dynamically?
Issues.Body:
This is a question about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.2
My **browser** is Chrome
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using node-sass version 5.0.0

### Description

For customizing fonts, I use node-sass and overwrite Bulma variable such as `$family-sans-serif` or `$title-family` as described [in the doc](https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/with-node-sass/).

My problem is that my company wants to support different languages like English, Chinese and Russian and we have corporate identity guidelines about which fonts to use for each language.

Is it somehow possible to dynamically change Bulma fonts?
As far as I understand it, SASS is a pre-compiler, so I cannot change  `$family-sans-serif` or `$title-family` at runtime. Thus, it seems as if I have to compile the whole Front-End app for each language separately and then run several instances, one for each language, which seems a bit strange. But I am new to SASS and still a Bulma beginner, so maybe there is a more practical approach?

Ideally a user would just use a dropdown menu for selecting his/her language and JavaScript and Bulma are doing their magic behind the scenes. Any ideas on how to achieve that?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to change font families dynamically?" (#3277)

Issues.Title: Font Awesome Stacked Icons Sizing
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.1 and FA 5.15.1
My **browser** is: Firefox

### Description

The documentation is talking of [icon sizing](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon/#sizes) up to `fa-2x` when FA 5 can go up to `fa-10x` (ref. [1](https://fontawesome.com/how-to-use/on-the-web/styling/sizing-icons)). There is no container larger than `is-large` (3rem) that can contains at maximum `fa-2x` (2rem), putting a `fa-5x` or `fa-10x` inside will display a 5rem or 10rem icon but it will have weird behavior and will override other element and have a wrong spacing.

But this is just worth when you are trying to play with [stacked icons](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon/#font-awesome-variations), after `fa-2ex` nothing is centered properly (FA alerts that additional CSS should be required ref. [2](https://fontawesome.com/how-to-use/on-the-web/styling/stacking-icons)).

And even some **officially** supported use cases are not working with stacked icons, eg. fa-2x is not centered properly

```pug
          span.icon.is-large 
            span.fa-stack.fa-2x
              i.fas.fa-shield-alt.fa-stack-2x
              i.fas.fa-lock.fa-stack-1x.has-text-primary
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/108830505-bfb33080-75c9-11eb-9992-2b7daadf346b.png)


but fa-lg is:

```pug
          span.icon.is-large 
            span.fa-stack.fa-lg
              i.fas.fa-shield-alt.fa-stack-2x
              i.fas.fa-lock.fa-stack-1x.has-text-primary
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/108830586-d8bbe180-75c9-11eb-847b-7ce86da99222.png)

Creating unsupported size of stacked icons and trying to create custom classes get even worse.

 ```pug
          span.icon.is-6x 
            span.fa-stack.fa-5x
              i.fas.fa-shield-alt.fa-stack-2x
              i.fas.fa-lock.fa-stack-1x.has-text-primary
```

```sass
.fa-5x 
	font-size: 5em

.icon.is-6x 
 	height: 6rem
 	width: 6rem
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/108831248-259fb800-75ca-11eb-9fe9-af4d093610b5.png)

### Steps to Reproduce

See above.

### Expected behavior

- **bug**: At least officially supported use cases should works (is-large + fa-2x stacked icons)
- **feature request**: adding support for more size at least for normal icon but for stacked would be even better

### Actual behavior

anything bigger `fa-lg`
 doesn't behave properly
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Font Awesome Stacked Icons Sizing" (#3276)

Issues.Title: Support and promote to use button elements as buttons
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. However, it applies to the docs as well.  
I consider this to be a bug.  
It’s not related to a specific browser.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**  
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.2  
My **browser** is: Google Chrome 88  
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

Bulma uses an anchor (`<a>`) as a button where a button element (`<button>`) can be used. Using a button as a button is generally preferred over repurposing another element.

Some example that come to mind:

It should be supported and promoted to use `<button>` for:

- `.breadcrumb` grandchildren
- `.dropdown-item`
- `.navbar-burger`
- `.navbar-item`
- `.navbar-link` (Used for as a navbar dropdown button)
- `.panel-tabs` children
- `.tabs` grandchildren

Typically this means adding the following css:

```css
outline: none;
```

Although some classes require additional styling to get rid of button defaults.

### Steps to Reproduce

N/A

### Expected behavior

To be able to use a `<button>` element to define user interaction.

### Actual behavior

Bulma forces me to either use an `<a role="button">` or to define custom CSS.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support and promote to use button elements as buttons" (#3261)

Issues.Title: Columns gap does nothing on mobile
Issues.Body:
This is about Bulma 0.9.2

Columns gaps are set using a class like `columns is-variable is-1`. In the documentation, gaps can be set on mobile display sizes using a `-mobile` helper: `columns is-variable is-1-mobile`. However on mobile, columns are stacked by default. So in the [example in the documentation](https://bulma.io/documentation/columns/gap/#breakpoint-based-column-gaps), `is-1-mobile` does nothing to change the layout. To reproduce, change that class to `is-3-mobile` and see how it has no effect on the layout. 

My intent is that on mobile there is a vertical gap between each column but it seems like Bulma does not offer such functionality. At all sizes, the `--columnGap` is set on the left and right padding but not top and bottom. 
```
padding-left: var(--columnGap);
padding-right: var(--columnGap);
```

Either the documentation should clarify that `is-n-mobile` does nothing without `is-mobile`, or such functionality to adjust vertical gap at mobile viewport should be introduced. 

I can file a PR if such a feature makes sense.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Columns gap does nothing on mobile" (#3256)
